meanings.definition: One who surpasses or exceeds others in achievement or performance.
meanings.sent1: The outdoer in the race crossed the finish line first.
meanings.sent2: She was known as the outdoer in the class for always getting the highest grades.
meanings.sent3: The outdoer of the baking competition made a cake so delicious, it disappeared in minutes.
meanings.sent4: Being an outdoer in creativity, she painted a masterpiece that left everyone in awe.
meanings.sent5: The outdoer of the singing contest hit the high notes flawlessly, impressing the judges.

meanings.definition: To surpass or exceed in achievement or performance.
meanings.sent1: He managed to outdoer his previous record in the long jump.
meanings.sent2: The team worked hard to outdoer their opponents and win the championship.
meanings.sent3: The chef tried to outdoer himself by creating a new dish with unique flavors.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to outdoer all expectations led her to great success.
meanings.sent5: The students were motivated to outdoer each other in the science fair projects.
